summary: The 'DOT Victim and Survivor Advocate Act' proposes the establishment of a National Roadway Safety Advocate within the Department of Transportation. This advocate will act as a liaison between the Department and stakeholders (victims, survivors, and their families) to provide education, collect feedback, and offer recommendations on roadway safety issues. The position is a career appointment and must submit annual reports to the Secretary of Transportation, highlighting systemic issues and proposing solutions. The Advocate has specific authorities and limitations regarding their role.
